summary: The Racehorse Tax Parity Act aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It seeks to reduce the holding period used to determine whether horses are considered section 1231 assets to 12 months. This change, if enacted, would be effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on February 7, 2025, by Mr. Barr (and Mr. McGarvey) and referred to the Committee on Ways and Means.
